questions.question: What is a register in digital electronics?

answers.a: A combinational circuit that performs arithmetic operations
answers.b: A sequential circuit that stores binary data
answers.c: A memory device that stores program instructions
answers.d: A logic gate that performs Boolean operations

explanations.a: Registers are not combinational circuits, they are sequential circuits
explanations.b: Correct! A register is a sequential circuit that stores binary data using flip-flops
explanations.c: While registers can be part of memory systems, they are not specifically for program instructions
explanations.d: Registers are not logic gates, they are storage elements

questions.question: What is the main difference between combinational and sequential circuits?

answers.a: Combinational circuits have memory while sequential circuits don't
answers.b: Sequential circuits have memory while combinational circuits don't
answers.c: Combinational circuits use more gates than sequential circuits
answers.d: Sequential circuits are faster than combinational circuits

explanations.a: This is incorrect. Combinational circuits don't have memory
explanations.b: Correct! Sequential circuits have memory elements (flip-flops) while combinational circuits don't
explanations.c: The number of gates is not the defining difference
explanations.d: Speed is not the defining characteristic between these circuit types

questions.question: In a SISO register, how does data move through the register?

answers.b: One bit at a time from input to output
answers.d: Bits move randomly through the register

explanations.a: This describes a parallel shift register, not a SISO register
explanations.b: Correct! In a SISO register, data moves one bit at a time from input to output
explanations.c: This describes a bidirectional shift register
explanations.d: Data movement in registers is deterministic, not random

questions.question: What is the purpose of the clock signal in a sequential circuit?

answers.a: To provide power to the circuit
answers.b: To synchronize the movement of data

explanations.a: The clock signal is not used for power distribution
explanations.b: Correct! The clock signal synchronizes when data moves through the circuit
explanations.c: The clock signal is not used for random number generation
explanations.d: While the clock affects when data moves, it doesn't control the input data itself

questions.question: What is the minimum number of flip-flops needed for a 4-bit SISO register?

explanations.c: Correct! A 4-bit register needs exactly 4 flip-flops
explanations.d: 8 flip-flops would be too many for a 4-bit register
